intro: Draba bruce-bennettii, commonly known as Bruce-Bennett's whitlow grass, is a small flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbages, and is characterized by its simple, basal leaves and small, white or pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine habitats, thriving in well-drained soils and cool climates. It is a perennial species, often found in high-altitude environments where it blooms in late spring or early summer. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species in its native range.
